metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20446 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
In xml.rs in GNOME librsvg before 2.46.2, a crafted SVG file with nestedpatterns can cause denial of service when passed to the library forprocessing. The attacker constructs pattern elements so that the number offinal rendered objects grows exponentially.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-rsvg-2.0 - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
librsvg2-2 - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
librsvg2-bin - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
librsvg2-common - 2.46.4-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: librsvg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.46.4-1ubuntu1').
